Ad Text:
Your mission, should you choose to accept it: To harness the power of our data and transform it into actionable insights that shape and lead us into the future.

We are a forward-thinking organisation dedicated to leveraging data and having a “single source of truth” that enables and fosters growth on a global scale.

We are seeking an experienced and driven Head of Data to lead all aspects of data management, including data strategy, governance, integration, and AI/analytics capabilities across the group. This pivotal role involves developing and overseeing our data initiatives, ensuring data integrity, and driving insights that inform our strategic goals.

With a strategic mindset and an exceptional ability to align data strategies with business objectives, you will take the lead in;

Designing and overseeing data integration frameworks that consolidate data from multiple sources, including on-premises and cloud-based systems.

Managing end-to-end data consolidation and transformation processes, ensuring accurate and timely availability of critical business data.

Developing and executing the organization’s data strategy, policies, and standards.

Leading the adoption and rollout of master data standards to ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity.

Championing the creation of meaningful data insights and dashboards leveraging the Amotiv data warehouse.

Integrating operational systems and functions into the data warehouse.

What You Bring to the Table

Formal Qualifications: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.

Experience: Demonstrated background and experience (5-7 years) in a leadership role within data management, data analytics, or a related field.

Knowledge: Strong knowledge of data governance, data architecture, and data warehousing.

Expertise: Strong expertise in data integration, data consolidation, and master data management.

Technical Skills: Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric and enterprise-scale data platforms. Advanced proficiency in SQL, and other database technologies.

Reporting & Analytics: Strong background in building and delivering reporting & analytics solutions in Power BI.

Soft Skills: Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to translate complex data into clear strategies and actionable insights.

AI Technologies: Demonstrated use of AI technologies (e.g., machine learning, predictive analytics, NLP) to drive business insights.

Emotional Intelligence: High emotional intelligence with the ability to build strong relationships, influence without authority, and manage up/across effectively.

*Please note that travel to divisional sites will be required (local and interstate)

What’s in It for You?

This role presents a fantastic opportunity to make a real difference through your partnership with stakeholders and by putting in place the initiatives that will underpin and enable the continued success of our business.

Balance: It's okay to leave for those moments that matter but be there and present when work needs to get done.

Fun and Fitness: We are competitive in a fun way, especially when it comes to table tennis and working out in the gym.

Growth: You can go outside of your lane, learn, and be involved – making the job your own.

Team Spirit: We work hard and we do it as a team – high energy, love a laugh, and create a welcoming and inclusive environment.

Join us and be a part of our exciting journey towards data-driven success!

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER (COGNOS & POWER BI)
About the Role

Lead the modernization of our business intelligence solutions as a BI Developer specializing in IBM Cognos and Microsoft Power BI. Play a key role in supporting the migration from Cognos to Power BI while delivering insights that support aged care policy, compliance, and program outcomes.

Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain BI reports, dashboards, and data models in Cognos and Power BI
Support and execute migration activities from Cognos to Power BI
Optimize report performance, data queries, and refresh processes
Contribute to standardized reporting templates and data governance practices
Provide technical guidance and mentoring to junior developers
What You'll Bring
5+ years' demonstrated experience in BI development using both Cognos and Power BI
Proven experience migrating BI artifacts and reports from Cognos to Power BI
Strong ability to design, develop, and optimize complex data models
Experience working in Agile, cross-functional data teams
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Contract: Full-Time/Contract - 12 Months

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

POWER BI & DATA ANALYST
About the Role

Transform raw data into actionable intelligence as a Power BI & Data Analyst. Work closely with stakeholders to design insightful reports, interactive dashboards, and data visualizations that drive business decisions.

Key Responsibilities
Gather requirements from stakeholders and translate into technical specifications
Connect to diverse data sources and use Power Query to prepare data
Design and build insightful reports and interactive dashboards using Power BI
Implement advanced data modeling and create measures using DAX
Perform data analysis, profiling, and quality assessment
Enable AI capabilities within Power BI and monitor usage optimization
What You'll Bring
Understanding of data governance frameworks and metadata management
Proficiency in Power BI, Power Query, and DAX
Experience connecting to cloud-based platforms, databases, and spreadsheets
Strong analytical and visualization skills
Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
Experience with data quality assessment and consultancy

Contract: Full-Time/Contract

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

SENIOR DATA MODELLER
About the Role

Shape the future of our data architecture as a Senior Data Modeller. Apply innovative analysis techniques and model results while maintaining system integrity. Work with enterprise data solutions to support complex IT project delivery and drive user experiences that deliver the right information at the right time.

Key Responsibilities
Develop Conceptual, Logical, and Physical Data Models for EDW Core and Access Layers
Set peer review and data modeling release standards
Conduct performance tuning and optimization activities
Facilitate continuous improvement in delivery principles and coding standards
Collaborate with delivery teams to identify and resolve data quality issues
What You'll Bring
5+ years' experience working with Enterprise Data Warehouses and associated technologies
Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions through SDLC & Agile practices
Experience with Teradata, Informatica, GCP, SAS, Cognos, Qlik, Oracle, Power BI
Strong SQL querying and data interpretation skills
Excellent stakeholder engagement abilities
Relevant qualifications/certification/accreditation

Contract: Full-Time/Contract - 12 Months

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Diversa Trustees Limited (DTL) is a specialist Trustee company focusing on superannuation funds in Australia, including retail master trusts, corporate funds, platform (wraps), Pooled Superannuation Trusts, and insurance only funds. 

Diversa has been operating for many years providing trustee services to approximately 24 APRA regulated superannuation funds, with in excess of $8 billion of assets under management. 

 About the role

The purpose of this role is to carry out investment governance and oversight management of the Trustee’s investment governance framework & policies. This role will also carry out and provide assistance in assessing new investment options for approval, monitoring and reporting processes consistent with APRA’s prudential standards. 

Looking for someone ideally with strong quantitative and qualitative experience in investments, ideally in superannuation.

Key Responsibilities  

Establish and maintain the Trustee Investment Governance Framework (IGF) for all RSE’s under trusteeship. 

Establishing and maintaining the policies, procedures and controls. 

Monitor adherence to the above and ensure that the IGF is compliant with and meets legislative requirements. 

Due Diligence on service providers and writing reports on the appropriateness of each provider.  

Provide assistance for specific investment issues raised by management and clients.  

Assist in the investment approval process to ensure consistent application of standards across all like clients. 

Management and review of product offerings under Trusteeship and associated disclosure documents, marketing collateral, and communications.  

Management of new product offerings or product improvement projects.  

Report writing for internal Committees as required. 

Knowledge and Experience 

Tertiary qualification in an appropriate discipline - in Finance, Commerce or Economics. 

Minimum of 5 years relevant financial services experience. 

Experience in establishing and maintaining the Trustee Investment Governance Framework (IGF) for all RSE’s under trusteeship. 

Experience in investment governance and/or oversight.  

Experience in writing reports and providing advice.  

Skills and Competency 

Analytical, data manipulation, and Microsoft Excel skills 

Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines 

Ability to work effectively as part of a close-knit team and demonstrate relationship building skills 

Strong written and verbal communication skills 

Effectively manage deadlines and understand new concepts quickly 

Proven problem-solving skills 

Tenacity & resilience, ability to remain calm under pressure 

Discretion and the ability to keep confidentiality 

High level of attention to detail, accuracy and organisational skills 

Benefits 

At Diversa, we value collaboration, teamwork, and diversity, and understand that through flexibility, our employees can achieve their best work life balance to support their professional goals while meeting their personal needs. 

Diversa offers an attractive remuneration package commensurate with skills and experience. 

You will have the opportunity to work in a professional, supportive, and friendly work environment in our CBD office as well as from home. 

If this sounds like the perfect place for you to take the next step in your career, please apply!

Company Background

Join a fast-growing fintech SaaS business as they scale their technology and platform capability across Australia. You’ll be part of a collaborative delivery environment where your technical expertise will directly shape how systems integrate, automate, and secure the company’s next phase of growth.




About The Role

As a Technical Business Analyst, you’ll work across engineering, product, and platform teams to translate business needs into scalable technical solutions. You’ll map data flows, define integration requirements, and support the delivery of secure, high-performing systems that underpin the company’s next phase of growth.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with developers, architects, and product teams to define functional and technical requirements
Analyse existing systems and integrations to identify gaps, dependencies, and improvement opportunities
Document user stories, data mappings, and API or interface specifications to enable efficient delivery
Partner with engineering to validate technical feasibility and ensure alignment with architecture and security standards
Support initiatives across data, platform, and cyber uplift including reporting, automation, and SaaS configuration
Participate in Agile ceremonies, backlog refinement, and user acceptance testing




About You

Experience as a Technical or Systems Business Analyst within fintech, SaaS, or technology-driven environments
Strong understanding of system integrations, APIs, and data flows
Exposure to SQL, data analysis, or API tools such as Postman or Swagger
Skilled in Agile delivery and comfortable working across multiple technical streams
Excellent communicator able to bridge business and technology teams
Analytical, detail-driven, and outcome-focused




Company Culture

You’ll join a collaborative, delivery-focused environment that values initiative and problem-solving. The company promotes open communication, continuous learning, and flexibility with hybrid working in place three days a week in their Sydney CBD office

ICT Business Analyst – Finance Systems & Consulting

Forward Logic is specialist consulting firm delivering ICT and finance system solutions to clients across Western Australia and international markets. Our work spans complex, multi-vendor environments where strong business analysis, business systems knowledge, and client-facing delivery capability are critical.

We are seeking an experienced ICT Business Analyst to support the delivery of various business system implementations, working closely with clients, internal delivery teams, and external software vendors.

Key responsibilities

Engage directly with clients to elicit, analyse, and document business, functional, and non-functional requirements for finance, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting systems

Work collaboratively with project managers, solution architects, and technical teams to support end-to-end ICT project delivery

Develop solution scopes, implementation plans, cost estimates, and budget inputs aligned with client and project requirements

Prepare vendor engagement and evaluation materials, including solution assessment criteria and comparison frameworks

Coordinate with software vendors to manage issue remediation, confirm fixes, and validate solutions against agreed requirements

Develop and execute test strategies and test plans, including user acceptance testing and defect management

Design and deliver structured training programs and knowledge transfer sessions to ensure successful client adoption of implemented solutions

Provide post-implementation support and documentation to support operational handover and ongoing system use

Skills and experience required

Demonstrated experience in an ICT Business Analyst or similar role within finance systems, ERP, planning, or enterprise application environments

Strong understanding of financial processes, including budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and cost management

Experience working across multi-vendor ICT solutions and coordinating with external software providers

Proven capability in requirements analysis, testing, and solution validation

Experience developing and delivering user training in client-facing environments

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to liaise effectively with both business stakeholders and technical teams

Ability to manage multiple workstreams and priorities in a consulting environment

Qualifications

Tertiary qualifications in information technology, business, economics, finance, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience

Why join us

This role offers the opportunity to work across diverse client engagements, contribute directly to solution delivery outcomes, and apply a broad skill set spanning analysis, delivery, and training within a collaborative consulting environment.

Senior Digital Literacy Project Lead:

About the Opportunity Our client, a major federal government department, is seeking a Senior Digital Capability Project Specialist to lead a high-profile, nationally significant initiative on adult foundational skills.

This short-term contract offers a rare opportunity to provide senior project leadership, policy expertise, and cross-agency coordination to deliver the Digital Literacy Foundation Skills outputs by 30 June 2026.

You will work collaboratively with the Department and other APS agencies, shaping foundational digital literacy policy and translating international frameworks into practical, decision-ready artefacts for Australia’s skills landscape.

This role is responsible for providing senior project leadership and policy guidance to ensure the timely delivery of outputs. You will apply your deep understanding of the Australian digital literacy policy landscape to ensure outputs are coherent, and usable across practice and policy settings.

Key Responsibilities:
Establish and maintain the project plan, schedule, dependencies, and quality controls
Lead governance processes, including steering committee and working group meetings, and prepare agendas, action logs, and decision records
Manage project scope, applying proven methods to prevent scope creep
Lead structured stakeholder engagement with the Department and other APS agencies to confirm scope boundaries, validate terminology, and ensure outputs are practical for foundational skills contexts
Coordinate messaging and engagement across a complex stakeholder environment
Deliver a gap analysis of the Digital Literacy Skills Framework and 
Provide concise weekly status updates, monthly progress reports, and a comprehensive handover pack, including outputs, decision logs, stakeholder maps, and maintenance guidance
About You: We’re looking for an experienced consultant who can lead complex, multi-stakeholder APS projects and deliver high-quality policy artefacts to tight deadlines. You will bring:

Proven experience leading cross-agency APS projects delivering policy, strategy, or framework outputs
Deep understanding of the digital literacy or foundational skills policy landscape in Australia
Exceptional ability to translate frameworks into practitioner-usable artefacts, with high-quality drafting and facilitation skills
Experience coordinating and influencing in central agency environments.
Strong organisational skills to manage multiple workstreams and maintain comprehensive project documentation
Eligibility
Must be an Australian citizen
Must hold a Baseline security clearance
Willing to undergo a police check
Apply today online with your CV and we will be in touch.

Job reference: 19182

Location: Sydney

Work type: 3-month fixed term with potential extension, full-time



About Us

Healius has an expansive network of over 100 medical laboratories and 2000 patient collection centres operating across metropolitan, regional and remote Australia.

We provide 1 in every 3 pathology services in Australia, extending from exclusively servicing some of Australia's largest and most complex private and public hospitals, to small Indigenous Australian communities.

This means that you will be working in a business large enough to offer you job stability & security, interstate mobility and the opportunity to fulfil your career ambitions.


About The Role

Healius is seeking a Senior Business Analyst / Associate to support three critical initiatives in the logistics space within a large and complex healthcare environment.

You will work across three key projects:

Logistics network optimisation
Logistics digitalisation
Cost-out of results delivery

This role will require you to balance priorities across all streams, engage stakeholders, and ensure changes are embedded successfully. You'll also play a key role in transitioning every business unit onto a single logistics platform

Key responsibilities include:

Driving and providing support for three active initiatives
Engaging with stakeholders to support changes and make them stick
Creating systems to ensure the new status quo is maintained
Presenting findings and results to the Executive Leadership Team


This is a 3-month fixed term with potential extension, based in our Sydney Head Office. Hybrid working arrangements are available. Occasional short business trips (~2 days) to Brisbane and Melbourne may be required.

About You

This role will suit a mid-senior level professional who is proactive, analytical, and thrives in complex environments. You can manage multiple priorities with confidence, ask the "why," define problems clearly, and push for solutions autonomously.

To succeed in this role, you'll bring:

3-5 years' management consulting experience as a Business Analyst, Associate, or similar
Background in logistics or healthcare (preferred)
Experience implementing large-scale changes supported by IT solutions
Strong stakeholder engagement skills and ability to influence outcomes
Comfort working across multiple projects simultaneously
Resilience, adaptability, and a collaborative mindset

We believe everyone leads, no matter what role they are in. Our ways of leading are the behaviours that we expect our people to embody and are: Customer Focused, Accountable, Collaborative, Credible & Resourceful.

.

.

Salary: Attractive Base Salary + Super + Shares + Bonus
Ad Text:
Company description:



Brand-new Perth CBD office - work from our modern new location in the heart of the city, with easy access to public transport, cafés and the waterfront

High-impact role with real influence - drive meaningful business improvements across a trusted WA energy brand

Backed by the Wesfarmers Group - enjoy stability, strong values, and genuine career development opportunities

Kleenheat has been providing energy solutions to homes and businesses across Western Australia for more than 65 years.

We're committed to delivering energy for today's customers and tomorrow's opportunities, with a focus on safe and reliable products and helpful customer service.

This is a truly unique opportunity to work with an established and trusted brand in the Perth market. Kleenheat is also well positioned for growth, having recently launched a new solar and battery offering for West Australians.

We pride ourselves on our values of One Team, Accountable, Customer Focused and Forward Thinking, with the understanding that our success is underpinned by our people.



Job description:



About the role 

Reporting to the Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping business solutions and driving process excellence across Kleenheat and Wesfarmers Chemicals, Energy & Fertilisers. This is not just about gathering requirements, you'll be a key partner in designing solutions, enabling data-driven decisions, and ensuring seamless delivery of initiatives that improve customer experience and operational performance.

Your focus will span solution design, requirements elicitation, customer journey mapping, stakeholder engagement, and agile delivery, with a strong emphasis on leveraging technology and data to optimise business systems and processes. Other key responsibilities will include:

Analyse complex business problems and identify improvement opportunities, including cost/benefit analysis.

Partner with stakeholders to define clear requirements, scope, and priorities for projects and enhancements.

Facilitate workshops and lead process mapping (As-Is / To-Be), customer journey mapping, gap analysis, and options evaluation.

Translate business needs into functional specifications and user stories for agile delivery teams.

Act as Initiative lead for selected initiatives, ensuring alignment between business objectives and technical solutions.

Support testing, deployment, and ongoing optimisation of Digital and back end systems.

Provide analytical and commercial insights to support strategic decision-making.

About You 

You're a strategic thinker and analytical problem-solver who thrives at the intersection of business, technology, and people. You challenge assumptions, uncover root causes, and deliver practical, scalable solutions that enhance both customer experience and business outcomes.

You will bring:

Tertiary qualifications in Business, IT, Project Management or equivalent experience

3+ years' experience in a business analyst, project analyst or project management role

Demonstrated experience working in Agile environments (Scrum experience preferred)

Strong stakeholder engagement, facilitation and communication skills

Excellent analytical, documentation and problem-solving capability

Experience delivering digital or technology solutions (B2C experience highly regarded)

Exposure to business case modelling, data analysis and reporting tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)

Experience with enterprise systems such as Oracle, SQL Server or similar (desirable)

We value our employees

  

At Kleenheat, we have a range of benefits to keep life flowing inside and outside of the workplace. 

Flexible work options for most roles including start/finish times or working a combination of days from the office and from home 

Kleenheat's employee discount off your residential natural gas account 

Competitive remuneration including allocation of Wesfarmers shares and participation in our annual incentive plan 

Time for family with parental leave payment up to 18 weeks 

Ongoing professional learning and development opportunities across our diverse businesses and the Wesfarmers Group to help you progress your career 

Access to a range of health and wellbeing initiatives including private health insurance discounts, our employee assistance program, annual flu vaccinations, support resources and our safety-first culture 

Salary sacrifice opportunities, including novated lease vehicle packaging 

Access to benefits across Wesfarmers including staff discounts at Bunnings, Kleenheat, Kmart, Target, Officeworks, Clear Skincare Clinics and Wesfarmers sponsored arts events 

 Why Kleenheat 

We welcome people with different skills, and life experiences and encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply.  

We pride ourselves on developing and supporting people and recognise the importance of flexibility. When you apply, please let us know if you are seeking a flexible employment. 

We are committed to building an engaged and talented workforce that is representative of the people who live in the communities where we operate. Fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results. We welcome and encourage people from diverse backgrounds and particularly, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. 

WesCEF operates across multiple locations, with our two major hubs in Kwinana and Perth CBD.  

Applications close: 5pm AWST 25th January 2026 

Our recruitment process considers your alignment to our company values and the requirements of the role. We also have several checks which may be conducted to demonstrate your suitability for the role including but not limited to psychometric assessment, police checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, right to work check, qualifications, due diligence and/or reference checks. 

We reserve the right to commence the recruitment process prior to the closing date. Therefore, it is recommended to apply as soon as possible. 

We respectfully ask that no agency resumes be presented at this stage.

Company Description

Minderoo Foundation is a modern philanthropic organisation. We take on tough, persistent issues with the potential to drive massive change. We incubate ideas and accelerate impact. We push the limits of what is believed possible.

Minderoo Foundation is independent, forward thinking and seeks effective, scalable solutions. We are proudly Australian, and one of Asia’s lar gest philanthropies. 

Minderoo’s Effective Philanthropy Enabler drives the foundation strategy and vision through a holistic, systems-thinking approach and the development of organisational capability. Develops long-term relationships with our philanthropic peers, deploys impact investments and sets and holds the central standards for impact-related activities, impact measurement, capability development and sustainability. Effective Philanthropy plays a vital role in providing thought leadership to realise the 2030 Strategy’s ambitions through its focus on ensuring a targeted and cohesive approach to philanthropy that amplifies our overall impact.




Job Description

We are seeking two Impact & Insights Principals to support Minderoo’s Gender Equality and Communities Focus Areas. Reporting to the Director, Impact & Insights, these roles sit at the intersection of strategy, impact measurement and learning. You will support Executive Directors and Focus Area teams to shape portfolios that are strategically coherent, evidence-led and focused on systems-level change.

Embedded within either the Gender Equality or Communities team, each Principal will play a leading role in strategic planning, portfolio coordination and impact measurement. You will support the design, approval and scaling of bodies of work; facilitate strategic planning and prioritisation processes; and steer alignment with Minderoo’s 2030 strategy. At the same time, you will lead impact measurement, evaluation and learning across the portfolio - designing and coordinating IML plans, ensuring fit-for-purpose impact and systems-change measures are embedded across work, advising on evaluation approaches, and supporting teams to use impact data and systems effectively. You will translate data, evaluation findings and learning into clear insights that inform strategy, portfolio decisions, reporting and continuous improvement.

These roles are ideal for a strategic thinker motivated to shape how Minderoo delivers impact at scale across complex social systems. You will bring deep experience in strategic planning and impact measurement, combined with strong facilitation and communication skills, and the ability to influence across portfolios. You are proactive, solutions-oriented, comfortable navigating complexity and bring a strong can-do attitude.




Qualifications

Demonstrated experience in impact measurement, evaluation, learning and reporting within complex organisations or systems-focused initiatives

Strong understanding of qualitative and quantitative evaluation methods, tools and frameworks, with experience generating insights to inform strategy and decision-making

Proven experience facilitating strategic discussions, workshops and decision-making processes, including navigating complexity, differing perspectives and conflict

Strategic planning, program design and portfolio coordination experience, preferably in related field(s) and contexts

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to analyse, synthesise and communicate complex information clearly and concisely

Strong collaboration and influencing skills, with experience working effectively in matrixed environments and across diverse internal and external stakeholders (e.g. community, government, private sector, academia)

Relevant postgraduate qualification (e.g. economics, social sciences, evaluation or related field), or equivalent professional experience

A passion for tackling big, systemic problems to catalyse change at scale.

A can-do attitude, a collaborative approach to working in a supportive team, and a strong alignment with all of Minderoo’s values




Additional information




Benefits

Flexible work arrangements that support your wellbeing

Ongoing career development and learning opportunities

A chance to be part of a values-driven organisation making a global impact

Engaging, inclusive and purpose-led workplace culture




Next Steps

Please attach your resume and a cover letter explaining why you interested in this opportunity.




Applications close: 

Tuesday 1 February 2026




Please note we reserve the right to extend closing date and/or close applications early should a suitable candidate be identified.

Principal Impact and Insights supporting our Gender Equality team -Perth or Sydney based candidates will be considered 

Please refer to our Privacy Policy.

Minderoo Foundation embraces Equal Opportunity and promotes diversity. We actively encourage Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islanders, people of all backgrounds, ages, sexual orientation, and those with Disability to apply.

Category Analyst 

Make an impact from day one 

Step into a hands-on marketing role where you’ll shape the plumbing products of the future  

North Sydney location close to all public transport




About GWA 

Join GWA and be part of a team that’s proud of its Australian and New Zealand roots, trusted expertise, and love of innovation, backed by some of the most well-known brands in the industry. 

For over 100 years, we’ve been designing quality products for homes and workplaces, including popular brands like Caroma, Methven, and Clark. You’ll be joining a company with a strong history and an exciting future. 

As a Category Analyst, this is a great opportunity to learn, grow, and make a real impact. You’ll support category and product strategy by translating customer, market and product data into insights that guide product development, range decisions and marketing execution, gaining hands-on experience and building skills from day one, with training and support along the way. 




What You’ll Do 

Product & Segment Strategy: Support Category and Segment Managers in managing product ranges across their lifecycle, from concept to launch through to optimisation and exit. 

Performance & Category Analysis: Analyse category, product and customer performance to identify trends and insights that inform range decisions, product positioning and marketing priorities. 

Market Intelligence: Research customer needs, market trends, and competitors to identify opportunities, trends and risks within a category. 

Reporting & Storytelling: Translate data into clear narratives using dashboards, visuals and presentations to support category planning, product launches and marketing decisions. 

Commercial Understanding: Support Category Managers with insights into performance drivers and trade-offs, helping inform balanced category decisions. 

Product Information Management: Make sure our product information is accurate, up to date, and easy to understand, so customers can confidently choose and use our products. 

Collaboration: Be part of a supportive team, working closely with Category and Segment Marketing Managers. You’ll help with analysis, insights, and problem-solving to improve overall business performance. 




What We Look For in You 

Bachelor’s degree or above (ideal areas: Marketing, Commerce, Business or related). 

Graduates or those with 1-3 years’ experience in Marketing, Product Development or adjacent roles. 

Strong Excel skills with the ability to analyse and interpret product, customer and market data. Working knowledge of business intelligence software preferred (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau). 

Interest in products, consumer behaviour and how data informs marketing and category decisions. 

Excellent written reporting, data visualisation and verbal presentation skills. 

Demonstrated analytical skills, creativity, and attention to detail. 




About You 

Combination of analytical and creative thinking. 

Good problem spotter and solver. 

Confident presenting recommendations supported by data and insights. 

Adaptable, with a continuous learning mindset. 




Why You’ll Love Working at GWA Group 

 

Join us as we continue our journey from Good to Great, where you'll collaborate with inspiring colleagues, engage with iconic brands, and contribute to a business with a legacy of strong growth. Take the first step towards an exciting career and become part of a team that's dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experiences and making a real difference in the world.  We value passion, potential, and a willingness to learn. 

  

Aside from a supportive and collaborative culture where you’ll be set up for success and know that you’re making a real difference from day one.  

  

Ready to apply? 

  

Great! Just click the apply button to build your career with us! 

  

Please note: You must be a citizen, permanent resident or hold all the relevant employment visas and other approvals for the location and duration of this position to apply for this role. 

We are not accepting applications from agencies for this position.

Category:
Compliance & Risk (Banking & Financial Services)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Hybrid work environment
Full-time/Permanent
Play an important part shaping the future of our iconic Australian institution


About the role


We are seeking a Lead Analyst, Operational Risk and Resilience to join the Business Risk Oversight team within Risk Management. This is a Line 2 role supporting the uplift of the Bank's operational risk and resilience practices. This role is ideal for someone who is eager to learn, contribute to meaningful work, and grow within a high-performing team.


You will work closely with departments across the Bank to strengthen operational risk management, provide independent oversight and assist with risk assessments, reporting, control reviews, and stakeholder coordination. You will also contribute to the development of frameworks and tools that support continuity of operations and effective third-party risk management


Key Responsibilities


Support the development and implementation of the Bank's operational risk and resilience frameworks.
Provide Line 2 oversight of risk and control assessments, including business continuity, incident response, and third-party risk.
Support the preparation of risk reports, dashboards, and governance materials.
Maintain and update risk registers, control libraries, and action plans.
Help coordinate responses to internal audits, regulatory reviews, and assurance activities.
Monitor key risk indicators (KRIs) and emerging risk trends.
Collaborate with Line 1 stakeholders to embed operational risk management.
Contribute to continuous improvement of risk processes, templates, and tools.



About you


7+ years' experience in operational risk, business continuity or a related discipline, ideally within financial services or a regulatory environment.
Strong understanding of risk management frameworks (e.g. ISO 31000) and regulatory expectations (e.g. CPS 220, CPS 234, CPS 230).
Experience working in or with large, complex organisations undergoing risk transformation is advantageous.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate risks into business impacts.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across functions.
Familiarity with GRC tools and risk reporting platforms is advantageous.
Relevant tertiary qualifications in risk, finance, economics, compliance, or a related discipline



About the team


Reporting to the Senior Manager, Operational Risk and Resilience within the Risk Management and Compliance team (Line 2), you will play a leading role in establishing effective Line 2 review, challenge, and insight across the Bank's material risk classes. Establishing strategic and trusted relationships across the Bank is fundamental to the team's success.


Be More

Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the people of Australia, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports your growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility. Your individual growth and success drives the RBA forward as an organisation. Be more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.


Why RBA?

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia's banknotes and operate infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people. Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people, values, and culture play a critical role in achieving our objectives. Striving to be Open & Dynamic, we consider and incorporate different perspectives, work across teams and are transparent with each other, whilst delivering quality together effectively and focusing on outcomes by prioritising, testing, learning, and refining as we go. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts. We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the RBA forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.


The Reserve Bank of Australia is committed to equity, diversity and inclusion through key initiatives. We welcome and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse background, those living with a disability and from the LGBTQ+ community. We are committed to making the recruitment process fair and equitable for all our candidates.

Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

You'll lead the data, reporting and insights capability within SEEK's People & Culture function across APAC. This role blends operational excellence with strategic planning and delivery. You'll be the key representative for people data, reporting and insights, driving value through technology advancements and strong stakeholder engagement.

There are multiple systems in P&C that will be in scope for this role both from a data governance and management perspective. The two primary systems directly in our control, as system owners, are Workday HCM and SmartRecruiters (ATS).

You'll lead a small team of specialists based in Melbourne and Kuala Lumpur, working closely with the Senior Manager, HCM Technology.

Success looks like delivering high-quality insights, advancing our data governance frameworks and leveraging emerging AI capabilities to transform how we make workforce decisions.

Responsibilities 

Maintain the P&C technology and data ecosystem in partnership with Technology teams and third-party vendors
Develop and improve data governance frameworks ensuring quality standards, security and compliance requirements
Partner with P&C and business stakeholders to continuously improve engagement and service delivery
Contribute to the P&C Technology and Insights Roadmap with ownership focus on People Insights
Lead and coach team members on prioritising, planning and delivery capabilities across APAC
Lead the team (APAC-based) in the development and maintenance of simple to complex reports, including matrix and composite reports, utilising Workday’s native reporting, analytics and visualisation capabilities
Deliver meaningful metrics and insights leveraging SEEK BI tools including Power BI, Tableau and Workday Discovery Boards
Engage across the broader organisation on the advancements in AI capabilities, and with a future-focus on leveraging Databricks at an enterprise level
Lead P&C data governance across forums, projects and audit reviews while maintaining documentation, processes and security standards
Manage defect resolution, prioritisation and resource planning for cyclical activities spanning monthly to annual deliverables
Qualifications
Extensive experience leading people data and analytics programs in global organisations (Workday HCM highly desirable)
Proven people leadership experience managing, coaching and developing distributed teams across multiple locations
Strong expertise in data management, data modelling, data architecture and data analysis
Experience with HR/Finance applications and report development/visualisation tools such as Workday Report Writer, Workday Discovery Boards, Workday Prism, PowerBI, Tableau, Databricks, etc.
Exceptional communication and influencing skills adaptable to operational and strategic business scenarios
Strong strategic thinking with ability to translate concepts into practical technology-enabled solutions
Highly agile/flexible when it comes to internal customer engagements at the operational level versus more partnering and consulting when it comes to strategic planning
Experience with AI applications in data and analytics

Other Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Tertiary qualification in IT or related discipline or other related tier-1 HCM system certifications
Translate strategic and conceptual thinking to practical solutions with technology as a key enabler
Ability to collect, organise, analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information, often highly confidential, with a high level of confidence and accuracy
Working knowledge of information systems, including experience in designing, building and testing reports
Ability to prioritise workload for the team, provide support and ensure timely resolution and/or delivery
Project Management experience, and experience using Trello, JIRA, Confluence and Slack
Additional Information

At SEEK we offer:

Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners
SEEK is committed to operating sustainably and is preparing for the impacts of climate change and the transition to a low-carbon future, and is working to minimise its environmental impacts which includes a long-term emissions reduction target of net zero by FY2050
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
Free kick-start breakfast every morning and fresh fruit available all day in our offices
Casual dress – every day

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

Purpose of the role 

The role will contribute value to Youi by applying actuarial principles to support key business decisions, with a particular emphasis on reinsurance.

Key priorities 

Prepare and review data for reinsurance renewals, catastrophe modelling and related requests.
Improve automation, timeliness and accuracy across reinsurance placement and reporting processes.
Ensure receipt of signed reinsurance contracts and prepare supporting management papers.
Maintain counterparty grades, adhere to the Reinsurance Management Strategy and assist with collateralisation and commutations.
Support drafting of regulatory reinsurance documentation (ReMS, Placement Strategy, ReAS, Reinsurance Declaration).
Calculate and allocate reinsurance premiums, complete true-ups and process payments.
Perform monthly reporting to reinsurers, process recoveries and prepare loss notifications.
Provide actuarial support outside reinsurance (IFRS 17, stress testing, capital modelling, reporting, climate strategy, business modelling, expenses).
Uphold risk-management practices, compliance requirements and the Actuarial Control Cycle.
Promote safety, operational efficiency and company values in day-to-day work.

About you 
Experience & Knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree in actuarial or related field, with progress toward actuarial qualification.
Minimum 3 years’ actuarial experience in general insurance; reinsurance experience preferred.
Strong analytical ability with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of actuarial standards, professional development requirements and IFRS 17 (beneficial).
Understanding of reinsurance, reserving, pricing and portfolio monitoring links.
Strong Excel skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (SQL beneficial).
High attention to detail, strong time management and ability to manage multiple priorities.
Demonstrated integrity, accountability and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive approach to identifying risks and opportunities with an innovative mindset.
Effective collaborator with a commitment to continuous professional development.

Ways of working 

Youi offers a hybrid model: in-office Tuesday to Thursday, remote Mondays and Fridays.

Sydney office:
Located in the heart of Sydney’s CBD, our office offers multiple commuting options, including bus, and trains.

Why Youi?

At Youi, we challenge the norm—in both insurance and hiring. With 3,000+ employees, we’re growing fast, driven by diversity, individuality, and a passion for awesome service. Our dynamic, honest, and human-focused team values every contribution. If you’re ready to make a difference, join us!

Work-Life Balance – 22 days of leave (including your birthday), paid volunteer day, and onsite wellness services.
Financial Perks – 15% insurance discount, retail deals, free footy tickets, and  financial wellbeing & health insurance consults.
Growth & Recognition – Career progression, paid study leave, and an award-winning reward & recognition program.

As a Circle Back Initiative member, we commit to respond to every application.

* Our Internal Talent Acquisition team handles all hiring, and we don’t accept unsolicited resumes sent to hiring managers. *

Data Governance Specialist | Queensland Government Sector

Are you a data governance expert with a talent for establishing frameworks and embedding best practices within complex environments? We are seeking a seasoned Data Governance Specialist for a critical engagement within a prominent Queensland Government entity.

The Opportunity

Operating within the insurance arm of the state government, this role is pivotal in establishing formal data ownership and governance across the entire organisation. Leveraging an existing framework, you will be responsible for developing comprehensive policies, onboarding key data roles, and ensuring rigorous compliance across all datasets.


This is a contract position running from 2 March until 30 June 2026, based full-time onsite at a premier Brisbane CBD location.


Key Deliverables

As the Data Governance Specialist, your primary focus will be to:

Develop and formalise a bespoke data governance policy and associated procedures specifically tailored to the organisation's needs.

Onboard and train key data governance roles, including Data Stewards and Data Custodians.

Ensure compliance with high-level data standards, focusing specifically on data quality, data lineage, and data integrity across all systems.

Produce documentation and training materials to support the long-term adoption of governance policies.

Collaborate closely with technical data professionals and business stakeholders to embed governance principles into daily operations.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:

Proven Experience: A strong track record in developing and implementing data governance frameworks, policies, and procedures.

Technical Knowledge: A deep understanding of data quality, lineage, and integrity principles.

Stakeholder Engagement: Exceptional communication skills with the ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and non-technical business stakeholders.

Training Capability: Experience in onboarding and mentoring roles such as Data Stewards and Custodians.

Industry Background: Previous experience working within the insurance sector or a similarly highly regulated environment.




Highly Regarded Skills:

Familiarity with Medallion Architecture (Raw, Standardised, Consumer layers).

Knowledge of Azure Databricks or equivalent cloud data platforms.

How to Apply

If you are ready to take ownership of a significant governance project and drive data excellence, please submit your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience.

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

About BHP 


At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role


Defines project objectives/schedules, identifies critical activities, monitors the project plan/schedule and drives continuous improvement initiatives across projects at BHP.  
Develops, predicts/forecasts and benchmarks project costs and estimates in line with industry standards, principles and practices.  
Develops safe project delivery and contractor performance strategies to maximise portfolio value and enhance improvement and innovation.  
Develops and communicates insights that guide data driven action and decision making.  
Determines the underlying cause of problems and evaluates multiple solutions to ensure a planned and structured approach to solving complex problems.  
Mitigates people, community, human rights and modern slavery, environmental and climate risks across the value chain, in alignment with public policy and our sustainability and climate commitments.  
Sources information, plans and conducts analyses to support evidence-based decision making.  
Engages the capabilities of the entire organisation.  
Strives to achieve 100% safety, 100% customer value and 0% waste.  
Knows our customer and is obsessed with meeting their needs. 

About You


Tertiary qualifications in Business (Finance or Accounting), Engineering, Quantity Surveying or related discipline.
Relevant experience with a Tier 1 management consulting company is highly desirable.
Project Management certification
Data analytics certification
Proven experience in cost management for complex capital projects or portfolios.
Experience in developing and implementing project management strategies and standards at an enterprise or program level.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and influence senior stakeholders.
Exposure to global Project Controls practices, innovation, and emerging technologies.
Track record of driving continuous improvement and embedding lessons learned across projects.
About Our Process 


At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. 

If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal. 

Supporting a Diverse Workforce  
 


The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.  

At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that’s more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.

BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.

About us 

At CitiPower and Powercor and United Energy, we’re proud to deliver electricity to 2 million Victorian customers every day through our network of poles and wires. But more than that, we’re here to power communities, support local businesses and keep critical services running smoothly, we’re essential to them all – and none of this happens without our people. As Victorians electrify everything from homes to transport, we’re focused on ensuring our networks are ready to meet that demand. If you want to be part of something essential, be essential with us. 

About the role 

This role leads the research, development, deployment, and continuous enhancement of advanced Computer Vision, Perception AI, and Spatial Intelligence capabilities to improve operational efficiency, asset intelligence, safety, and automation across the electrical distribution network. Working with high-dimensional multi-modal data—including imagery, video, spatial datasets, and selected LiDAR/3D applications—the role delivers core perception technologies that enable a variety of digital and hardware initiatives. It is also responsible for establishing robust MLOps practices to ensure scalable model development, reliable deployment, ongoing monitoring, and continuous improvement. The role works collaboratively with other specialised teams across the organisation to ensure alignment, clear boundaries, and efficient integration of related capabilities. 

Key responsibilities 

Lead, coach, and develop a specialised team of computer vision, perception AI, and spatial AI engineers to deliver high-quality outcomes.

Create and maintain the Perception & Spatial AI Capability Roadmap, ensuring alignment with organisational priorities and complementary teams.

Own the full lifecycle of vision and perception models, including data management, training, validation, deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement.

Implement scalable MLOps pipelines for data ingestion, model versioning, CI/CD for ML, retraining, and operational monitoring.

Lead the design and development of advanced computer vision and perception AI models for detection, segmentation, anomaly identification, change detection, and scene understanding.

Build scalable perception algorithms using imagery, video, 3D spatial data, and multi-sensor inputs to support operational decision-making.

Collaborate with the Generative AI (agentic applications) team on multi-modal solutions where perception outputs integrate with LLMs, agents, or decision systems.

Employ generative AI techniques—such as synthetic data, diffusion models, or multi-modal fusion—to strengthen perception model performance. 

For more information on the role’s responsibilities, please click here to download the position description. 

What you’ll need from day one 

7+ years in AI/ML roles with strong computer vision or perception experience.

Deep expertise in computer vision and perception AI.

Prior leadership of AI/ML teams is strongly preferred.

Experience in utilities, energy, infrastructure, robotics, or other asset-intensive industries is advantageous.

Proficiency in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, and GPU-accelerated computing.

Knowledge of imagery, video, spatial modelling, and selective LiDAR use cases.

Tertiary qualification in computer science, ML/AI, engineering, robotics, or a related field. 

If you believe you have what it takes but don’t meet every requirement—or if you’d like to discuss flexible working arrangements to meet the key responsibilities —we encourage you to get in touch. 

Key Benefits 

We’re proud to offer an inclusive, supportive workplace where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to grow. Some of our benefits include hybrid work options, purchased leave, 15 weeks of gender neutral primary parental leave, health and wellbeing subsidiary, career development and planning opportunities, and exclusive discounts. Visit our company website to learn more. 

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion to support a fair workplace for all 

We are committed to building a safe, inclusive, and supportive workplace where people of all genders, ethnicities, sexual orientations, abilities and ages are valued for who they are and empowered to do their best. Through our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Strategy (DEI), Reconciliation Action Plans and initiatives like Women in Power and Sparkle, our LGBTQIA+ allies network, we’re working to create equal opportunities for all. We are proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. Explore our partnership with Work180. 

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, and strongly encourage First Peoples, women, people from the LGBTIQA community, culturally and racially marginalised people and people with disabilities to apply. We recognise how people from marginalised groups can face extra barriers and self-select out of recruitment processes.  With this in mind, we’re committed to making reasonable adjustments to ensure a positive, barrier-free recruitment process. 

What’s next 

Submit your application via our careers’ website by 26 January 2026. To make a confidential reasonable adjustment query, please contact Luke Castro from the Talent team at careers@powercor.com.au 

Please note that this ad has hyperlinks (which are not supported by Seek). To access them, please go to our Careers website.

Job Description

This is a rare opportunity to shape SEEK’s technology direction at the enterprise level. You’ll lead the development of frameworks, models, and planning to create insights that help shape SEEK’s technology decisions and direction. In this highly visible role, you’ll collaborate across Product, Tech, Strategy, and Finance, influencing the way SEEK prioritises and delivers change that matters.

What You’ll Be Doing

Design and curate SEEK-wide enterprise architecture assets and models that guide technology decisions
Lead strategic insights, modelling, and planning initiatives to create technology insights that inform executive priorities and investment planning
Champion the use of LeanIX and other tooling to create visibility into SEEK’s technology landscape
Develop integrated roadmaps that surface opportunities, dependencies, and strategic enablers
Build and maintain strong partnerships with Tech Strategy, Portfolio Management, Finance, and senior leaders

The Opportunity

You’ll be part of SEEK’s Enterprise Architecture & Operations team, working closely with architects and senior leaders to support key business shifts. This is a high-trust role with direct visibility and influence at the executive level, ideal for a strategic thinker who thrives on shaping the future of tech through connected insights.

Qualifications
Significant experience in enterprise architecture or strategy roles across complex, fast-moving tech environments
Proven experience delivering concise, high-impact models, frameworks, and insights for executive decision-making
Hands-on capability with enterprise architecture tooling (ideally LeanIX) to support strategy and planning
Deep understanding of business capability models, application catalogues, and tech investment planning
Exceptional ability to engage, influence, and present to executive audiences with clarity and insight
Collaborative and strategic mindset with the ability to connect the dots across disciplines and drive alignment

Job Title: Head of Financial Planning, Analysis & Systems
Ad Text:
Hewitt is a global, vertically integrated food business supplying organic and high-claims red meat to customers across Australia, North America and Asian markets. As we continue to realise our global ambition to scale and grow internationally through acquisitions and organic growth, we are seeking an experienced Head of FP&A. This exciting and career defining role will help mature and develop the global FP&A function for the business.

The Role

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this role owns enterprise-wide planning, forecasting, performance reporting, and financial systems. It provides a single, accurate view of business performance and ensures scalable, reliable systems and data underpin executive decision-making, working closely with the Group Financial Controller and Commercial Business Partners.

Key Responsibilities

Own global budgeting, forecasting, and long-range planning cycles

Deliver enterprise performance reporting for the Executive and Board

Own financial planning, reporting, and consolidation systems

Maintain a single source of truth for financial data and KPIs

Drive automation, standardisation, and process discipline across finance

Provide scenario modelling and insights to support strategic decisions

About You

10+ years’ experience in FP&A, financial systems, or management reporting roles

Proven ownership of planning and reporting systems in multi-entity or global environments

Strong technical expertise in modelling, forecasting, and financial analytics

Solid understanding of financial data architecture and system integration

Experience leading centralised FP&A teams and delivering enterprise reporting

Degree in Finance, Accounting, or related discipline; CA / CPA / CFA preferred

Join Hewitt for the Opportunity of a Lifetime

Senior, high-impact role partnering closely with the CFO and Executive

Opportunity to build scalable, enterprise-grade FP&A and systems capability

Values-driven organisation with a long-term strategic focus

Competitive remuneration package

Ongoing professional development

Access to our 24/7 Employee Assistance Provider

A fun and vibrant culture

Hewitt is committed to equal opportunity employment and to fostering a workplace that values equity, diversity, and respect. Reasonable adjustments are available throughout the recruitment process.

By applying, you acknowledge that proof of eligibility to work in Australia will be required.

All candidates will be contacted in due course.

Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst - Data & Analytics (Supply Chain)
Ad Text:
The Senior Technical Business Analyst – Data & Analytics partners with Supply Chain stakeholders to define business problems, assess current data and reporting ecosystems, and shape future-state analytics capabilities using modern cloud data platforms and emerging AI technologies.

This role combines strong business analysis, data discovery, and stakeholder engagement skills with a forward-looking mindset, focusing on how advanced analytics, automation, and AI can enhance decision-making and operational performance. The role suits someone comfortable working with ambiguity and helping establish new ways of working in an evolving analytics and AI-enabled environment.

Key Responsibilities
Lead discovery to understand Supply Chain data flows, ingestion, lineage, and transformation across cloud data platforms (e.g. Snowflake, Databricks, or equivalent).
Assess current BI and reporting environments (e.g. Power BI, Tableau), identifying gaps, risks, and opportunities to enable advanced analytics and AI-driven insights.
Partner with senior stakeholders to define business problems, ideate data, analytics, and AI use cases, and improve operational efficiency and productivity.
Facilitate workshops and interviews to gather and document business, functional, and non-functional requirements, including data governance, privacy, and security considerations.
Define current-state and future-state processes and translate requirements into epics, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Contribute to data, analytics, and AI strategy by providing structured analysis and clear recommendations aligned to business outcomes.
Skills & Experience
Proven experience as a Senior or Technical Business Analyst delivering data, analytics, or AI-enabled initiatives.
Strong experience with modern cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, or AWS/Azure/GCP equivalents).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills, including facilitation with senior business leaders.
Experience in Supply Chain or Manufacturing environments is highly desirable.
Demonstrated interest in emerging AI technologies, including exploratory use cases, proofs-of-concept, or applied analytics.
This is a day-rate contract opportunity, and the hiring manager is seeking the right team member to join as soon as possible.
